use_cases.title: Creating a New Plugin Skill
use_cases.description: Developer wants to add a skill to their Claude Code plugin that triggers when users ask for specific functionality. Follows 6-step process: understanding examples, planning resources, creating structure, editing SKILL.md, validating, and iterating.
use_cases.target_user: Plugin developers building domain-specific Claude extensions

use_cases.title: Improving Skill Discoverability
use_cases.description: Developer's skill doesn't trigger when expected. Uses guidance to strengthen frontmatter description with specific trigger phrases like "create a hook" or "validate tool use" instead of vague descriptions.

use_cases.title: Organizing Skill Content with Progressive Disclosure
use_cases.description: Developer has a 5,000-word SKILL.md that bloats context. Learns to keep SKILL.md lean (1,500-2,000 words) and move detailed patterns to references/, working code to examples/, and utilities to scripts/.
use_cases.target_user: Developers creating complex skills with extensive documentation

use_cases.title: Fixing Writing Style Issues
use_cases.description: Skill uses second-person language like "You should validate inputs." Converts to imperative form: "Validate inputs before processing." for AI consumption consistency.
use_cases.target_user: Content authors adapting human documentation for AI skills

output_examples.input: Help me create a skill for database migrations in my plugin
output_examples.output: Guides through 6 steps: (1) Understanding use cases - "What migration tasks will users perform?", (2) Planning resources - scripts/migrate.sh, references/schema-patterns.md, (3) Creating structure in skills/db-migrations/, (4) Writing SKILL.md with trigger phrases like "run migration", "create migration", (5) Validation, (6) Iteration based on testing

output_examples.input: My skill description is 'Helps with hooks.' Why isn't it triggering?
output_examples.output: Identifies weak description issues: not third-person, no specific triggers, too vague. Suggests: 'This skill should be used when the user asks to "create a hook", "add a PreToolUse hook", "validate tool use", or mentions hook events (PreToolUse, PostToolUse, Stop).' Shows plugin-dev/hook-development as example.

best_practices: Use third-person in frontmatter description: "This skill should be used when..."
Include specific trigger phrases users would actually say
Keep SKILL.md body under 3,000 words, ideally 1,500-2,000 words
Write entire skill in imperative/infinitive form, not second person
Move detailed content to references/ for progressive disclosure
Provide working examples in examples/ directory
Create utility scripts in scripts/ for common operations
Reference all supporting files clearly in SKILL.md
Study plugin-dev's skills as real-world templates
Test skill triggers with expected user queries before publishing
anti_patterns: Vague descriptions without specific trigger phrases (e.g., 'Provides guidance for hooks')
Using second person anywhere (e.g., 'You should create a hook')
Putting everything in SKILL.md without references/ (>3,000 words)
First-person or missing third-person in description
Creating unreferenced files that Claude doesn't know exist
Duplicating content across SKILL.md and references/
Using generic descriptions that don't indicate when to trigger

faq.question: What's the difference between references/, examples/, and scripts/?
faq.answer: references/ contains documentation loaded as needed (schemas, patterns, guides). examples/ contains working code users can copy. scripts/ contains executable utilities Claude can run (validators, testers). All are optional and loaded progressively.

faq.question: How long should SKILL.md be?
faq.answer: Target 1,500-2,000 words for the body, maximum 3,000 words. Longer content should be moved to references/ to avoid bloating context when the skill loads.

faq.question: Why use third-person in description instead of second-person?
faq.answer: Third-person ("This skill should be used when...") maintains consistency for AI consumption and clearly specifies triggering conditions. Second-person is ambiguous about when the skill should activate.

faq.question: Do plugin skills need to be packaged as ZIP files?
faq.answer: No. Unlike generic skills, plugin skills are distributed as part of the plugin itself. Users get skills automatically when they install the plugin. No packaging step needed.

faq.question: How does Claude discover my skill?
faq.answer: Claude Code auto-discovers skills by scanning the plugin's skills/ directory for subdirectories containing SKILL.md. Metadata (name + description) is always loaded. The body loads when the skill triggers based on description matching.

faq.question: What makes a good trigger phrase?
faq.answer: Specific, concrete phrases users would actually say: "create a hook", "validate tool use", "add a PreToolUse hook". Avoid vague terms like "work with hooks" or "help with configuration".
